content.intro: Networking ki basic concepts - OSI model, TCP/IP, protocols aur network architecture samajhna zaroori hai ethical hacking ke liye.

sections.heading: OSI Model Layers
sections.text:
7 Layers of OSI Model:

1. Physical Layer - Cables, signals
2. Data Link Layer - MAC addresses, switches
3. Network Layer - IP addresses, routers
4. Transport Layer - TCP, UDP ports
5. Session Layer - Sessions management
6. Presentation Layer - Encryption, compression
7. Application Layer - HTTP, FTP, SSH

sections.heading: TCP/IP Model
sections.text:
4 Layers of TCP/IP:

1. Network Access Layer (Physical + Data Link)
2. Internet Layer (Network)
3. Transport Layer (TCP/UDP)
4. Application Layer (Session + Presentation + Application)

content.intro: Network protocols ki detailed understanding - TCP/IP stack, protocol analysis aur network communication mechanisms.

sections.heading: TCP Protocol Analysis
sections.text:
TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) Features:

• Connection-oriented protocol
• Reliable data delivery
• Flow control mechanism
• Error detection aur correction
• Sequence numbering
• Acknowledgment system

TCP Header Fields:
• Source Port (16 bits)
• Destination Port (16 bits)
• Sequence Number (32 bits)
• Acknowledgment Number (32 bits)
• Window Size (16 bits)
• Checksum (16 bits)

sections.heading: UDP Protocol Analysis
sections.text:
UDP (User Datagram Protocol) Characteristics:

• Connectionless protocol
• Unreliable delivery
• No flow control
• Minimal overhead
• Fast transmission
• Used for DNS, DHCP, SNMP

UDP Header (8 bytes only):
• Source Port (16 bits)
• Destination Port (16 bits)
• Length (16 bits)
• Checksum (16 bits)

sections.heading: ICMP Protocol
sections.text:
ICMP (Internet Control Message Protocol):

• Network layer protocol
• Error reporting mechanism
• Network diagnostics
• No data transfer

Common ICMP Types:
• Type 0: Echo Reply (Ping Response)
• Type 3: Destination Unreachable
• Type 8: Echo Request (Ping)
• Type 11: Time Exceeded
• Type 30: Traceroute

content.intro: Wireless network security assessment - WiFi protocols, encryption methods, aur wireless attack techniques.

sections.heading: WiFi Security Protocols
sections.text:
WiFi Security Evolution:

1. WEP (Wired Equivalent Privacy)
   • RC4 encryption
   • 24-bit IV
   • Easily crackable
   • Deprecated

2. WPA (WiFi Protected Access)
   • TKIP encryption
   • Dynamic keys
   • Better than WEP
   • Still vulnerable

3. WPA2 (WiFi Protected Access 2)
   • AES encryption
   • CCMP protocol
   • Strong security
   • Current standard

4. WPA3 (WiFi Protected Access 3)
   • SAE (Simultaneous Authentication of Equals)
   • Enhanced Open
   • 192-bit security
   • Latest standard

sections.heading: WPA/WPA2 Security Assessment
sections.text:
WPA/WPA2 Attack Methods:

1. Dictionary Attack
   • Wordlist based
   • Common passwords
   • Time consuming

2. Brute Force Attack
   • All combinations
   • Very time consuming
   • Guaranteed success

3. Rainbow Tables
   • Pre-computed hashes
   • Fast lookup
   • Storage intensive

4. WPS Attack
   • PIN brute force
   • Pixie dust attack
   • Quick results
